intro: Cenia microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed cenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact size and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Cenia microcephala is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
